P070108.project_name: Savings and Credit Sector Strengthening and Rural Microfinance Capacity Building

keywords.cdata: accounting,adverse selection,Agriculture,arbitrage,Auditing,audits,Bank Procedures,Bank Restructuring,banking sector,banking services,BORROWING,Capacity Building,capitalization,Central Bank,central banking,commercial banks,competitiveness,Consolidation,Credit Law,credit policies,Credit Unions,debt,deposit insurance,deposits,development agencies,development banks,economic impact,Environmental Management,environmental protection,Evaluation criteria,Exchange Rate,financial crises,financial institutions,financial intermediaries,financial intermediation,Financial Management,Financial Markets,financial performance,Financial Sector,Financial Services,financial stability,financial transactions,FISCAL YEAR,Fisheries,Fishing,GDP,good governance,Gross Domestic Product,human development,income,Indigenous Peoples,Information Dissemination,institutional capacity,Institutional Development,institutional framework,institutional reforms,interest rates,International Development,Key Performance Indicators,laws,legal framework,legislation,liquidation,local communities,local institutions,mergers,Microfinance,municipalities,national economy,operating costs,performance standards,personal savings,portfolios,poverty alleviation,private,producers,profitability,Regulatory Framework,risk management,rural communities,SAPs,Savings,Savings Associations,savings programs,Securities,Social Development,Sustainable Development,sustainable growth,Technical Assistance,telecommunications,Value added

project_abstract.cdata: The Project builds upon, and enhances the Bank's overall program of strengthening Mexico's financial sector, and providing targeted assistance to the rural poor. Its main objective is to contribute to the integration of low-income people into the national economy, realize their income generating potential, and increase their access to financial services. The components will support: 1) consolidation of the savings and credit institutions (SCIs) sector, by strengthening eligible institutions, improving SCIs infrastructure, and enhancing sector supervision. An assessment, preparation, and implementation plan will assist in SCIs restructuring (e.g., mergers or acquisitions) through technical assistance (TA) provision, based on an evaluation criteria, which includes liquidation of unviable institutions, to be determined on case-by-case basis. Moreover, an information system will be integrated, to enable sector institutions to provide financial reports, maintain accounts and financial information, and provide other operational, control, and reporting services. A training program for SCI management, and staff will include modules in the areas of finance, accounting, risk management, credit analysis, and governance, while supervision procedures and competencies will be supported through training on micro-finance institutions, and TA to adapt regulations as needed; 2) community training, to be provided to the poorer segments of marginal populations on basic household finance, and financial transactions. TA will support activities under this component; 3) consulting services, and studies aimed at improving financial intermediation, sector performance, and auxiliary supervision. The component also includes dissemination programs, workshops, and training in rural micro-finance activities; and, 4) project management, through an operational core team at implementing agencies to im
